jobs.title: Transformation Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As a Transformation Analyst, you will be an integral part of a high-performing team within the Strategic Transformation Office. You will partner closely with Senior Transformation Directors to support execution of complex, high-value transformation programs with strategic customers.

This is a growth-focused role for an early-career professional with strong analytical capabilities, curiosity, and a desire to contribute to industry-shaping deals. You’ll work cross-functionally across sales, consulting, and value engineering to drive data-backed insights and deliver compelling, customer-centric outputs.

What you'll do at UiPath

Engagement & Execution Support

  • Prepare and support strategic design-thinking workshops with customers to identify high-impact opportunities for agentic automation

  • Develop business case materials, industry research, and customer-facing collateral

  • Translate customer objectives into initial hypotheses, models, and input for commercial deal structures

Data & Insight Generation

  • Conduct quantitative and qualitative research to support bespoke commercial strategies business cases

  • Analyse customer data to identify value drivers, ROI, and agentic automation potential

  • Build initial ROI, TCO, and performance tracking models under guidance from senior team members

Strategic Program Enablement

  • Help coordinate workshops, discovery sessions, and internal planning meetings

  • Document key insights and actions from CxO meetings and provide briefing packs for STO leaders

  • Track progress of transformation initiatives and assist with internal communications and reporting

Knowledge & Capability Building

  • Develop fluency in UiPath’s platform, automation operating models, and enterprise delivery best practices

  • Contribute to refining and evolving STO assets, frameworks, and toolkits

What you'll bring to the team

  • 1–3 years of experience in strategy, consulting, value engineering, or enterprise sales support

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Comfort with financial modeling and performance analysis

  • Familiarity with automation, digital transformation, or enterprise software is a plus

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to manage multiple tasks with competing deadlines

  • Self-starter with a collaborative mindset

  • Fluency in English & German

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Principal Technical Analyst AI&Automation
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

UiPath is pioneering the future of work through AI-powered automation. Our mission is to accelerate human achievement by enabling organizations to automate intelligently, at scale. We’re growing our Competitive Intelligence team with a Principal Technical Analyst who will work under Product Strategy, leading deep technical insights and strategic market intelligence across the AI & Agentic Automation landscape.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead in-depth evaluations and hands-on testing of AI and automation technologies shaping the market

  • Produce structured, high-impact reports on industry trends, product capabilities, and emerging innovations to inform strategic decision-making

  • Translate complex technical findings into clear, actionable guidance for executives, product leaders, and go-to-market teams

  • Develop enablement assets such as technical briefs, newsletters, and thought leadership content to keep internal teams informed and aligned

  • Partner with product, strategy, engineering, and sales leadership to identify opportunities for differentiation and market growth

  • Support strategic initiatives and customer-facing engagements with timely technical and market insights


What You’ll Bring

  • Deep mastery of AI and Agentic technologies, generative AI, and intelligent automation ecosystems.

  • Extensive experience in senior technical analyst, business analyst, or technical advisory roles with demonstrated leadership impact

  • Proven track record in digital transformation consulting, solution engineering, or pre-sales roles supporting enterprise technology decisions

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to evaluate, compare, and synthesize technical products and market dynamics into actionable strategies

  • Expertise in creating and delivering technical and market insight materials for diverse internal audiences

  • Familiarity with automation platforms (e.g., UiPath Agentic Automation, Intelligent Document Processing, BPMN tools) and enterprise SaaS ecosystems

Bonus Points For

  • Experience in consulting firms, technology product companies, or working closely with UiPath partners

  • Exposure to AI/ML-driven SaaS platforms, enterprise automation, or strategic go-to-market initiatives at scale

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Web Developer, Marketing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

The UiPath.com team is looking for an accomplished, hands-on web developer focused on developing and enhancing our website which seeks to be the front-door to UiPath.

As the web developer, you will have a direct impact on a large-scale, high-impact website that is visited by millions of people a month and is directly contributing to lead generation and the company bottom line. Our website is distributed globally through CDNs and is directly connected to a large scale API first headless CMS — Contentful. Prior experience on developing large scale websites at scale is highly preferred along with a passion for building the best web experiences with an eye to pixel perfect design.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Develop and maintain features for UiPath.com.

  • Optimize front-end performance and improve user experience.

  • Work closely with designers, product managers, and other engineers.

  • Debug and fix issues in existing applications.

  • Ensure code quality through reviews and best practices.

  • Participate in Agile development processes.

  • Stay updated with emerging web technologies and best practices.

  • Develop and maintain full-stack applications using Gatsby, Node.js, and React.

  • Work with backend services using Node.js and MongoDB.

  • Gain experience working with Azure services such as Azure Function Apps, Key Vault, Pipelines, and workflow automation.

  • Implement CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.

  • Configure and manage reverse proxies for web applications.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 3-5 years of experience in full-stack web development with Gatsby, Node.js, and React.

  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, CSS.

  • Experience in working with MongoDB.

  • Familiarity with version control systems like Git.

  • Good problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

  • Adhere to established development practices and processes.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Contentful and developing Contentful Custom Apps.

  • Basic experience with Azure services, including Function Apps, Key Vault, and Pipelines.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission


UiPath Automation Suite is a patent pending cloud native application delivery platform which enables UiPath to deliver all the automation applications to any kind (Cloud, On-prem, Air-gapped) of customer infrastructure. This is complete containerized platform which heavily uses Kubernetes and bunch of other CNCF technologies to deliver infra-agnostic application delivery and runtime platform. This platform enables customers to install and run UiPath’s suite of applications on a single server or on hundreds of servers based on their need.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • You will be architecting, designing, developing, and maintaining internet scale web applications and platforms.

  • You will be providing technical leadership to a team of engineers.

  • You will employ Agile methodologies like Scrum to plan and deliver committed results keeping relevant stakeholders in the loop along the way.

  • You will help define and refine engineering processes across the team.

  • You will work closely with Engineering Managers, Product Managers and UX Designers in defining and prioritizing the roadmap of the product.

  • You will analyse product usage and operational data to help drive systemic improvements across the product.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 7+ years of experience in software engineering, developing large scale commercial applications & platforms.

  • 1+ years of experience in building products using Kubernetes stack and related CNCF technologies like Docker, Helm, Istio, Rook CEPH, Prometheus etc.

  • Good knowledge of Linux internals and BASH scripting.

  • Working knowledge of one or more cloud infrastructures like AWS or Azure or GCP

  • Familiarity with build systems, CI/CD tools (like Azure DevOps, Jenkins), application analytics/monitoring

  • Experience of building and delivering enterprise grade products to highly secure on-prem environments of customers is a plus.

  • History of contributions to Open-source projects, is a plus.

  • Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming, programming principles and best practices using at least one end programming language/framework like Java, C#, GoLang

  • Strong knowledge and experience in distributed systems, caching, SQL and/or No-SQL databases like SQL Server, Oracle, Mongo, Redis

  • Strong problem-solving skills, understanding of standard Data Structures & basic algorithms, space & time complexities.

  • Deep understanding in debugging, troubleshooting and application performance tuning skills.

  • Experience with back-end integration, web services & APIs, REST/OData/GraphQL, JSON, XML, ProtoBuf etc.

  • Thorough understanding & experience of unit testing, functional testing, scale, and load testing related tools.

  • Familiarity with agile software development practices, TDD, code reviews, idea prototyping, distributed product teams

  • Ability to evaluate design approaches, tools etc., build frameworks and improve existing systems.

  • Experience in providing technical leadership, mentoring, and driving team of engineers towards defined objectives.

  • Strong customer passion, accountability, and drive to enhance customer experience working well with teams across the organization.

  • Strong bias for action, be adaptable and exhibit uninhibited entrepreneurial spirit with a can-do attitude.

    #LI-VR1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Sales Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

The Sales Engineer is a strategic technical advisor to prospects, customers, and the UiPath field sales team, providing technical support and guidance throughout the sales process. This role enables the field sales team to navigate complex customer requirements and deliver tailored automation solutions, ensuring the technical aspects of the customer’s journey are fully supported.

As a technical expert, the Sales Engineer acts as a trusted advisor to both internal teams and external stakeholders. The primary goal is to provide technical insights and solutions that align with customer needs while supporting the field sales team in executing territory goals and business objectives.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Build and deliver custom-made industry-specific demos for new prospects and clients, ensuring technical needs are met.

  • Create powerful POCs (Proof of Concepts) to demonstrate technical feasibility and innovation.

  • Identify technical challenges and showcase appropriate solutions to address them.

  • Provide technical training, seminars, webinars, and other activities to support field sales teams and drive end-user adoption of UiPath products.

  • Identify and resolve technical gaps during customer engagements, ensuring alignment between solutions and customer needs.

  • Present the technical design, value, and ROI of proposed UiPath solutions to customers and prospects.

  • Stay informed about competitive products and technologies to address customer concerns effectively.

  • Relate client business challenges to technical solutions within the UiPath platform.

  • Mentor, coach, and train other technical resources as needed.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 5+ years career experience in a technical or engineering role preferably from financial services and/or management consulting

  • 2-3 years of experience with UiPath or other RPA tools in a technical capacity.

  • Ability to build and maintain customer relationships vital to supporting sales efforts.

  • Strong technical knowledge of UiPath solutions and architecture.

  • Proficiency in coding and scripting in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, C#, Java) with a passion for solving technical challenges.

  • Ability to validate solutions and translate them into messaging for sales and technical teams.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly.

  • Strong ownership and proactive problem-solving skills.

  • Strong presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent industry experience in a technical field.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. jobs.descriptionPlain:
LIFE AT UIPATH

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?


YOUR MISSION

The Sales Engineer is a strategic technical advisor to prospects, customers, and the UiPath field sales team, providing technical support and guidance throughout the sales process. This role enables the field sales team to navigate complex customer requirements and deliver tailored automation solutions, ensuring the technical aspects of the customer’s journey are fully supported.

As a technical expert, the Sales Engineer acts as a trusted advisor to both internal teams and external stakeholders. The primary goal is to provide technical insights and solutions that align with customer needs while supporting the field sales team in executing territory goals and business objectives.


WHAT YOU'LL DO AT UIPATH

 - Build and deliver custom-made industry-specific demos for new prospects and clients, ensuring technical needs are met.

 - Create powerful POCs (Proof of Concepts) to demonstrate technical feasibility and innovation.

 - Identify technical challenges and showcase appropriate solutions to address them.

 - Provide technical training, seminars, webinars, and other activities to support field sales teams and drive end-user adoption of UiPath products.

 - Identify and resolve technical gaps during customer engagements, ensuring alignment between solutions and customer needs.

 - Present the technical design, value, and ROI of proposed UiPath solutions to customers and prospects.

 - Stay informed about competitive products and technologies to address customer concerns effectively.

 - Relate client business challenges to technical solutions within the UiPath platform.

 - Mentor, coach, and train other technical resources as needed.


WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE TEAM

 - 5+ years career experience in a technical or engineering role preferably from financial services and/or management consulting

 - 2-3 years of experience with UiPath or other RPA tools in a technical capacity.

 - Ability to build and maintain customer relationships vital to supporting sales efforts.

 - Strong technical knowledge of UiPath solutions and architecture.

 - Proficiency in coding and scripting in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, C#, Java) with a passion for solving technical challenges.

 - Ability to validate solutions and translate them into messaging for sales and technical teams.

 - Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly.

 - Strong ownership and proactive problem-solving skills.

 - Strong presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

 - Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent industry experience in a technical field.

jobs.title: Enterprise Acount Executive (Senior)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As an Enterprise Sales Executive for the Dutch market, you will be responsible for driving growth with strategic enterprise accounts across the Netherlands. Based from our Amsterdam office (hybrid), you’ll work closely with both regional and international teams to shape and execute go-to-market strategies and position UiPath’s AI and automation solutions with senior decision-makers.

With a consultative sales approach, you will identify opportunities, develop value-driven business cases, and build strong long-term partnerships with C-level stakeholders.

This is what you'll do at UiPath

  • Achieve and exceed revenue targets within the Dutch enterprise segment.

  • Develop and execute strategic account plans to drive expansion, upsell, and cross-sell opportunities.

  • Own the full sales cycle – from prospecting and value discovery to complex contract negotiation and closing.

  • Collaborate with internal teams including Product, Solutions Engineering, Strategy, Marketing, and Operations to shape solutions based on customer needs.

  • Stay ahead of AI and automation developments within your accounts and the Dutch market to proactively identify opportunities.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 5–8 years of experience in enterprise or strategic sales within a technical software or SaaS environment.

  • Strong network and trusted relationships with senior stakeholders in large Dutch organizations (finance, industry, tech, energy, or public sector preferred).

  • Proven track record in closing complex, multi-stakeholder deals.

  • A consultative mindset focused on value, long-term partnerships, and business impact rather than just transactions.

  • Strategic thinking, natural curiosity, and a genuine enthusiasm for the impact of AI and automation on business transformation.

  • Fluent Dutch and English are preferred

Team environment

You’ll be part of a hybrid team based in our Amsterdam office, where we value ownership, flexibility, and the freedom to make a real impact. We work in an environment built on trust and empowerment, focusing on results rather than rigid processes.

#LI-RB2

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: AI Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Help shape the future of Intelligent Document Processing at UiPath


At UiPath, we’re on a mission to accelerate human achievement through the power of automation. Our Intelligent Xtraction & Processing (IXP) solution transforms how businesses process documents and communications—leveraging the latest proprietary and foundation models with advanced data processing techniques to extract structured data quickly, accurately, and at scale.


As an AI Product Manager in the IXP team, you will be the voice of the customer, shaping product strategy, driving execution, and ensuring IXP sets the industry standard for AI-powered document and communication processing. You’ll collaborate closely with engineering, design, and customer-facing teams to deliver a product that delivers real business value —while also expanding IXP into new content types based on market demand.
If you’re passionate about AI, user-centric design, and building impactful solutions that turn unstructured content into actionable insights, we’d love to have you join our team.

What you’ll do

  • Define and communicate the IXP product vision, aligning it with UiPath’s strategy, market opportunities, and customer needs.

  • Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle—planning, prioritizing, and delivering features using scalable and agile development practices.

  • Act as the voice of the customer by gathering insights through telemetry, interviews, and direct engagement to shape product decisions.

  • Validate and refine features early to ensure they deliver accuracy, usability, and real-world value for non-technical business users.

  • Coordinate across teams to resolve dependencies, remove roadblocks, and keep projects on track.

  • Enable internal and external stakeholders through demos, documentation, training materials, and clear roadmap communication.

What you’ll bring

  • Proven experience managing engineering backlogs and delivering customer-facing software products, ideally involving AI/ML and unstructured data processing.

  • Strong business acumen and product management expertise, with a track record of optimizing end-to-end delivery processes.

  • Solid understanding of agile principles and iterative development, with the adaptability to navigate ambiguity.

  • Excellent communication and influencing skills, able to engage effectively with both technical teams and executive stakeholders.

  • Experience shaping UX for technical and non-technical users, ensuring usability and adoption.

  • Proficiency in English and a data-driven, proactive approach to problem-solving.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Vice President, Customer Marketing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Why This Role Matters

At UiPath, we’re redefining what automation means in an era of AI and agents. This role is central to shaping how our customers’ voices, stories, and successes fuel our growth—and how we in turn help them unlock even greater value with automation.

The VP, Customer Marketing will lead a large, global team of senior marketers responsible for advocacy, storytelling, executive communities, insights, and lifecycle engagement. As a manager of managers, this leader will build organizational strength and scale through talent development, empowerment, and cross-functional alignment.

As a member of the Marketing Leadership Team (MLT) reporting directly to the CMO, the VP will also play a critical role in shaping global marketing strategy and execution—helping drive alignment, innovation, and impact across the full marketing portfolio.

What You’ll Lead

• Organizational Leadership: Build and lead a global, multi-disciplinary team—including senior directors and managers—while fostering a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous development.

• Customer Advocacy & Evidence: Build scalable programs for references, case studies, peer reviews, and customer-led storytelling that support pipeline and brand credibility.

• Customer Lifecycle Marketing: Partner across Sales, CS, and Product to design programs that drive adoption, expansion, and renewal across key segments and verticals.

• Executive Communities & Advisory Boards: Lead customer councils, advisory boards, and executive peer forums that deepen relationships with senior stakeholders and generate actionable insights.

• Content & Industry Storytelling: Define UiPath’s editorial voice across owned channels, executive platforms, and industry media—making automation, GenAI, and agentic systems accessible and compelling.

• Social & Digital Voice: Lead UiPath’s social strategy and digital storytelling to amplify customer impact and spark conversation across channels.

• Voice of Customer Insights: Establish mechanisms (surveys, feedback loops, advisory programs) to capture customer sentiment and bring those insights into product, sales, and marketing strategies.

• Marketing Leadership Contribution: Serve as a key voice within the MLT, driving cross-functional collaboration, strategic decision-making, and global execution beyond the scope of Customer Marketing.

How You’ll Work Across the Org

• Partner with Product Marketing to translate positioning into customer-validated, industry-aligned narratives.

• Collaborate with Demand Gen and Field Marketing to fuel integrated campaigns with authentic customer stories and lifecycle content.

• Work with Customer Success and Sales to ensure adoption and expansion programs are embedded into GTM motions.

• Align with PR, Analyst Relations, and Corporate Comms to elevate UiPath’s market leadership through customer-driven proof and storytelling.

What You’ll Bring

• 15+ years in customer marketing, advocacy, content, or communications in enterprise B2B tech.

• Proven track record building and leading large global teams, including senior people leaders.

• Expertise in customer advocacy, executive communities, and lifecycle marketing.

• Strong POV on what makes content and stories resonate in a crowded, AI-driven market.

• Experience leading multi-disciplinary organizations spanning advocacy, content, and executive programs.

• Skilled at cross-functional alignment, with the ability to influence Product, Sales, and Marketing leadership.

• A passion for amplifying customer success and making complex technology stories understandable, engaging, and business-relevant.

  • Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States for this role

#LI-EC1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Principal AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Join UiPath, where we combine automation and AI to accelerate human achievement. We are building the future of intelligent automation through agentic automation, creating agents that handle complex tasks autonomously. As a Principal AI Engineer, you will drive contributions to core components of our platform, with a major focus on developing capabilities like Context Grounding (https://docs.uipath.com/automation-cloud/automation-cloud/latest/admin-guide/about-context-grounding). This essential service provides the foundation for our AI Agents (such as those built with Autopilot and Agent Builder) to understand and interact effectively with enterprise data and applications.

#LI-MH1

What you’ll do at UiPath:

  • Lead the architecture, design, development, and operation of large-scale cloud services, particularly focusing on AI-driven components of the UiPath platform.

  • Drive the technical strategy and evolution of system architecture, analyzing complex issues, proposing solutions, and ensuring alignment with business and technical needs.

  • Take ownership of software deliverables, ensuring they meet high standards of quality, security, scalability, performance, and maintainability.

  • Champion and continuously improve engineering best practices across teams, including CI/CD, testing, security, and operational excellence, fostering a culture of quality and velocity.

  • Incubate new ideas, stay abreast of emerging technologies, particularly in AI/GenAI, and drive their adoption where relevant to the product roadmap.

  • Collaborate closely with product managers, UX designers, researchers, and other stakeholders to define, refine, and execute the technical product roadmap.

  • Mentor and grow engineers across teams, fostering technical excellence, conducting design reviews, sharing knowledge, and helping them advance in their careers.

  • Actively participate in hiring, onboarding, and attracting top engineering talent.

  • Drive root cause analysis and implement long-term solutions for production issues, ensuring system reliability and performance.

What you’ll bring to the team:

  • A proven track record of 8+ years in software engineering, including significant experience architecting and delivering complex, large-scale commercial applications or platform services.

  • Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI, or a related technical field, OR equivalent practical experience.

  • Demonstrable experience in shipping commercial products or features leveraging Generative AI (GenAI) technologies. Deeper experience with specific Large Language Models (LLM), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), LLMOps, or transformer-based models is highly valuable.

  • Expertise in key programming languages such as Python (especially with AI/ML frameworks), TypeScript, and C#, backed by solid object-oriented programming principles and computer science fundamentals.

  • Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, architectural design patterns (e.g., microservices, event-driven), and system design for building highly scalable, distributed, and reliable platform services.

  • Significant experience designing, building, and operating cloud-based systems (Azure preferred, experience with AWS/GCP is also relevant).

  • Strong grasp of multithreading, asynchronous programming, API design (REST, gRPC), and building reliable, high-performance cloud services.

  • Experience with service-oriented architecture (SOA), microservices, and web services development.

  • Proven ability to provide technical leadership, drive technical strategy for platform components, mentor engineers, and foster best practices (including CI/CD, automated testing, monitoring, alerting, and modern DevOps principles).

  • Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) principles and tools (e.g., Terraform).

  • Ability to work effectively within globally distributed teams.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly to diverse audiences.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

Join UiPath, where we combine automation and AI to accelerate human achievement. As a Principal AI Engineer, you will drive contributions to core components of our platform, with a major focus on developing capabilities like Context Grounding (https://docs.uipath.com/automation-cloud/automation-cloud/latest/admin-guide/about-context-grounding). This essential service provides the foundation for our AI Agents (such as those built with Autopilot and Agent Builder) to understand and interact effectively with enterprise data and applications.

#LI-MH1

 - Lead the architecture, design, development, and operation of large-scale cloud services, particularly focusing on AI-driven components of the UiPath platform.

 - Drive the technical strategy and evolution of system architecture, analyzing complex issues, proposing solutions, and ensuring alignment with business and technical needs.

 - Take ownership of software deliverables, ensuring they meet high standards of quality, security, scalability, performance, and maintainability.

 - Champion and continuously improve engineering best practices across teams, including CI/CD, testing, security, and operational excellence, fostering a culture of quality and velocity.

 - Incubate new ideas, stay abreast of emerging technologies, particularly in AI/GenAI, and drive their adoption where relevant to the product roadmap.

 - Collaborate closely with product managers, UX designers, researchers, and other stakeholders to define, refine, and execute the technical product roadmap.

 - Mentor and grow engineers across teams, fostering technical excellence, conducting design reviews, sharing knowledge, and helping them advance in their careers.

 - Actively participate in hiring, onboarding, and attracting top engineering talent.

 - Drive root cause analysis and implement long-term solutions for production issues, ensuring system reliability and performance.

 - A proven track record of 8+ years in software engineering, including significant experience architecting and delivering complex, large-scale commercial applications or platform services.

 - Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI, or a related technical field, OR equivalent practical experience.

 - Demonstrable experience in shipping commercial products or features leveraging Generative AI (GenAI) technologies. Deeper experience with specific Large Language Models (LLM), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), LLMOps, or transformer-based models is highly valuable.

 - Expertise in key programming languages such as Python (especially with AI/ML frameworks), TypeScript, and C#, backed by solid object-oriented programming principles and computer science fundamentals.

 - Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, architectural design patterns (e.g., microservices, event-driven), and system design for building highly scalable, distributed, and reliable platform services.

 - Significant experience designing, building, and operating cloud-based systems (Azure preferred, experience with AWS/GCP is also relevant).

 - Strong grasp of multithreading, asynchronous programming, API design (REST, gRPC), and building reliable, high-performance cloud services.

 - Ability to work effectively within globally distributed teams.

 - Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly to diverse audiences.

jobs.title: Enterprise Account Executive (SEA)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your Mission

As an Account Executive, you will drive growth and success for our Large Enterprise Accounts across industries in Malaysia, Singapore and the Philippines. The individual will be responsible for account development and customer satisfaction by building key relationships and ensuring clients achieve maximum business value from UiPath solutions. In our high-growth culture, you'll have significant autonomy to help shape the company while transforming how clients perform in the digital era. You will serve as the voice of our existing clients and collaborate with cross-functional teams to influence UiPath's product development strategy.

This is what you'll do at Uipath

  • Engage meaningfully with C-level and Executive decision makers to identify new opportunities with large enterprise customers

  • Develop and execute multi-year strategic account plans to meet or exceed customer business objectives and maximize wallet share

  • Manage and forecast sales pipeline to consistently achieve revenue targets and company goals

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for all matters specific to key accounts

  • Collaborate with internal teams to enhance customer satisfaction, address challenges, and create seamless experiences

  • Drive a culture of sales excellence through consistent implementation of sales processes and performance metrics

  • Build strong relationships with industry influencers, customers, and partners to enhance UiPath's market position

  • Conduct regular business reviews with stakeholders to ensure alignment and strategic progress

This is what you'll bring to the team

  • 8 + years of experience in field sales, selling enterprise SaaS/cloud solutions to C-level executives

  • 5+ years of experience selling specifically to Conglomerates / Large Enterprises

  • In-depth technical understanding of automation and digital transformation

  • Proven record of accomplishment of consultative strategic sales with C-level prospects

  • Experience building relationships with CXO’s of large enterprise customers for business expansion

  • Demonstrated success in developing long-term account strategies with existing customers

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills of local language with ability to engage at all organizational levels

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Partner Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

UiPath is looking for a Partner Account Manager to manage and grow the business with partners in Indonesia. UiPath works across a portfolio of partners: global consulting partners, global systems integrators, local system integrators, technology alliance, value-add resellers, and distributors.

In this role, the individual will be responsible for the entire eco-system. You will spend most of your time with a small number of strategic focused partner and a limited set of incubation partners you will grow into becoming strategic. You will do this in tight collaboration with the regional partner team and in country sales leadership. This individual plays a critical role in driving growth, leveraging partners’ competencies and capabilities. This individual will work with the key executives of the partner to influence their enterprise automation practice, solution development, customer engagement, certified resources, and marketing plan. This role will also drive partner experience, and she/he will be the voice of partners to the internal audience. She/he is the owner of Partner NSAT in these partner accounts.

She/He will work with internal functional teams: direct sales, pre-sales, customer success, consulting, professional service, value engineering, marketing to drive overall GTM plan. This will involve working in a highly matrixed organization, requiring a high level of teamwork, collaboration, and influence. She/he will need to align partners’ GTM strategy to the overall country partner and sales strategy and help to prioritize investments to create largest business impact. Successful execution in this role will manage the partners’ strategy and execution to accelerate growth and take it to the next level, with close collaboration with the functional teams. The successful candidate must balance strategic-thinking with tactical execution; build effective and enduring partner relationships, drive highly cross-functional processes, possess a sound technical understanding of UiPath technology.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Accelerate UiPath’s sales trajectory, new business, and scalability by partnering with in country sales leaders to prioritize partners and activate sales engagement.

  • Execute a strategic partner sales and marketing strategy to meet and/or exceed the sales targets fuelled by significant growth in partner sourced and partner led business.

  • Drive business plan execution for the country leveraging partners; works with key stakeholders, cross functional teams and leverages established networks outside own area of expertise to create framework and drive execution.

  • Partner with other partner team members and direct sales team members to identify pipeline gaps and opportunities to scale; participate in development of programs and execution.

  • Consult with partner and direct sales leaders to help optimize and enable their selling teams’ execution with key partners.

  • Engage customer success, value engineering and consulting team to work with the partners to expand the enterprise automation agenda with the end customers.

  • Work with partners to drive customer success and ensure on time renewal. Most importantly, upsell and/or cross-sell to the end-to-end enterprise automation platform.

  • Continue to drive and cultivate joint sales engagement with sales segments/verticals; identify opportunities and remove obstacles.

  • Influence partner marketing investments in support of partner business and align to partner account growth plan; ensure marketing provides regular reporting on program results.

  • Play an instrumental role in the Regional Partner Leadership team, contributing beyond just assigned partners’ achievement but also lead on some special initiatives and programs across region.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 10+ years’ experience in Partner and/or Sales Management at enterprise level in the software/SaaS industry.

  • Proven track record in building/managing strategic partners in the local market.

  • Deep hands-on experience in working with partners on building practice, developing solution, ramping up certified partner resources & executing partner marketing plan.

  • Demonstrate abilities to work with strategic partners to win key accounts, generate pipelines, expand geographical coverage, and penetrate key verticals.

  • Willing to move fast and set bold ambition, and yet humble to listen and learn while being 100% immersed and focus on the role.

  • Passion and creativity to build and make an enterprise automation market with strategic partners.

  • Ability to excel in a highly matrix organization, strong collaboration skills.

  • Highly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and others

  • Takes initiative, and is a self-starter, resilient, comfortable with constant change and ambiguity.

  • Strategic thinker, who is also execution oriented; ideally has experience driving cross functional programs or processes.

  • Effective at building relationships (internally and with partners), collaborating, and influencing others; experience working with senior executives/partners in cross-company projects.

  • Strong communication skills in local language as well as English, able to convey complex ideas in a clear, concise manner both verbally and in writing, comfort in business and technical discussions.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Sneior Enterprise Account Executive Nigeria
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

Work with the largest companies across Nigeria. We work every day with C-level executives and business leaders, through to heads of process improvement and of automation, to deliver business and individual value at client organizations.


What you'll do at UiPath

  • Analyze the territory/market potential and develop sales strategies to maximize revenue potential.

  • Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within quarterly schedule.

  • Evangelize UiPath’s brand in the marketplace by presenting, promoting and selling our solutions by leveraging a value selling approach.

  • Educate customers on how our solutions can benefit them financially and professionally.

  • Establish, develop, and maintain positive business and customer relationships in the territory.

  • Develop trusted relationships with local partners and global systems integrators to cultivate new opportunities and drive successful customer implementations

  • Partner with the CSM group to ensure the customers receives maximum value and expedites customer issues as they arise.

  • Monitor our industry competitors, new products, and market conditions to understand a customer's specific needs.

  • Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.

  • Also, as an employee of UiPath you are required to comply at all times with UiPath’s policies that were communicated to you from time to time and that are available on Inside UiPath.


What you'll bring to the team

  • Ability to communicate new and complicated concepts in an easy-to-understand way that creates a high level of desire for the solution.

  • Ability to grow an enterprise client portfolio.

  • High aptitude for cross functional collaboration and cross functional influence internally and externally.

  • Strong ability to navigate a client organization and develop key points of contact in multiple departments and multiple levels of leadership.

  • Provides valuable insights into how to improve the customers business operations.

  • Have a research and data driven approach to account planning.

  • Ability to proactively identify opportunities from business led discussions.

  • Highly developed Critical thinking skills to solve customer problems and to bring deals to fruition when roadblocks are present.

  • Ability to sell to a financial buyer based on value and a business case vs feature and function

  • Fluent English.

#LI-GW1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. jobs.title: Marketing Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Location: Paris, France (on-site)
Duration: 1 year
Start Date: 1st September 2025
Department: Marketing – EMEA South

UiPath (NYSE: PATH) is a global leader in agentic automation, empowering enterprises to harness the full potential of AI agents to autonomously execute and optimize complex business processes. The UiPath Platform™ uniquely combines controlled agency, developer flexibility, and seamless integration to help organizations scale agentic automation safely and confidently.

Committed to security, governance, and interoperability, UiPath supports enterprises as they transition into a future where automation delivers on the full potential of AI to transform industries.

This is what you'll do at UiPath

As a Marketing Intern for France and Southwest Europe (Iberia, Italy, Benelux), you will contribute to:

  • Event Marketing: Support the planning, execution, and follow-up of both physical and virtual events across France, Iberia, Italy, and Benelux.

  • Campaign Collaboration: Assist in local and global marketing campaigns and customer advocacy initiatives across EMEA and globally.

  • Web & Paid Media:

  • Validate French translations and localize content for UiPath’s website and paid campaigns.

  • Help craft and launch new digital campaigns in collaboration with regional and global teams.

  • Localization & Translation: Work closely with our translation agency to review and approve localized content in French (and Spanish) for the website.

  • Cross-Team Collaboration: Partner with marketing and sales teams across France, Iberia, Italy, and Benelux in English, French, and Spanish.

  • Strategic Projects: Contribute to branding strategy initiatives and collaborate with creative agencies on ad hoc marketing projects.

This is what you'll bring to the team

  • Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field (M1 or M2)

  • Fluency in English and French required; Spanish skills highly valued

  • Strong attention to detail for translation and localization work

  • Ability to balance academic commitments with internship responsibilities

  • Proactive mindset and eagerness to contribute to cross-regional projects

  • Basic understanding of digital marketing concepts and brand consistency

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As a Software/AI Engineer in our Applied Sciences team, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, bridging the gap between cutting-edge research and practical applications. You'll be developing and optimizing LLMs, as well as building user-facing features for our suite of AI products. You'll work in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with cross-functional teams to create scalable, efficient, and reliable solutions that empower UiPath users to bring their automation ideas to life.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Working understanding of LLMs and common patterns/techniques: prompt engineering, in-context learning, RAG, etcWorking understanding of LLMs and common patterns/techniques: prompt engineering, in-context learning, RAG, etc

  • Build and maintain full-stack components for various AI products using Python, or C#, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.

  • Design and develop intuitive human-computer interfaces that make machine learning models accessible to all users.

  • Conduct regular benchmarks, perform statistical analysis, and present findings to drive data-informed decisions.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to launch new features and improvements to our AI platforms.

  • Contribute to maintaining code quality, organization, and automation practices within the team.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 3-5 years of experience in software development, with a focus on AI/ML technologies.

  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and architectural design patterns.

  • Experience with full-stack development and at least one high-level programming language (C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, etc.).

  • Knowledge of basic data structures, algorithms, and their associated time/memory complexities.

Nice-to-have skills:

  • Experience working as a software engineer on AI products.

  • Familiarity with prompt engineering and natural language processing.

  • Understanding of multithreading, synchronization, and asynchronous programming.

#LI-CE1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Applied Scientist II
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As an applied scientist, you'll work at the intersection between research and product. You'll build, optimize and deploy machine learning models as well as scale them up.
We’re looking for people who love machine learning and computer science, are interested in the theory behind the models, and are motivated to solve real world problems with techniques that are scalable, efficient, and reliable in production.
The ideal candidate is someone wanting to prove and better themselves in a fast-paced machine learning group. You need to be kind, courteous, motivated, self-starting, honest and responsible.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Build and improve modern machine learning models to solve complex ML problems.

  • Read papers, propose model improvements, implement and test the new models.

  • Think about the best human-computer interfaces to make machine learning models accessible to everyone.

  • Run regular benchmarks and perform statistical analysis, draw conclusions on the impact of your research-based optimizations and present your findings to the team.

What you'll bring to the team

  • Knowledge of Python and modern ML libraries like PyTorch, Tensorflow, or JAX.

  • Ability to implement models from academic papers like ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS, etc.

  • Strong quantitative intuition and mastery of linear algebra, probability and statistics.

  • Solid knowledge of basic data structures (list, vector, stack, heap), basic algorithms (sort, search, etc.) and associated time/memory asymptotic complexity.

#LI-CE1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.
