 - Proven track record of successfully owning and driving the development of complex software products from ideation to launch, with a focus on execution and delivering results.

 - Technology savvy with knowledge of enterprise platform deployments for both on premise and cloud providers such as AWS, Azure and GCP.

 - Experience and knowledge of Kubernetes, Linux administration and Linux internals is a plus.

 - Ability to drive large-scale projects from inception to launch, while dealing with ambiguity and competing priorities

 - Self-starter with a growth mindset, adaptability, and a drive for continuous improvement.

#LI-VR1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy https://www.uipath.com/legal/trust-and-security/privacy-policy.

jobs.title: Renewals Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Life at UiPath
The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.
To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

UiPathの社員は、エージェンティック・オートメーションが世界を変える変革をもたらすと信じています。私たちはその力を解き放つ、業界をリードするエンタープライズソフトウェアの開発に尽力しています。またUiPathの日本法人は、日本のお客様に最大限貢献することを目指し、独立性のある一つの組織として一丸となり取り組んでいます。RPAのロボットとAIエージェントとヒトが協働する未来の働き方を、一緒に実現しませんか？

そのために、好奇心旺盛で、自ら進んで動けるフットワークの軽い人材を求めています。ビジネスのスピードや変化を喜びとし、互いを思いやり、成長意欲のある仲間が必要です。UiPathでエージェンティックオートメーションを実現し、共に社会を変革しましょう。

募集内容：

リニューアルスペシャリストとして、皆様のご参加をお待ちしております。当社は実績ある成長を続けるリニューアルチームの一員として、実績のあるチームに加わり、顧客維持率の向上という当社のミッションに大きく貢献していただきます。リニューアルチームは、アカウントチームやカスタマーサクセスチーム、パートナーや顧客、社内の関係者と密に連携し、UiPath のお客様がUiPath への投資から継続的な成功を収めることができるよう支援する、UiPatheの成功に欠かせない部門です。

職務内容：

リニューアルスペシャリストとしての主な職務は、顧客基盤のオンタイムリニューアル収益を推進し、大量の取引とトップダウンのポジショニングのバランスを保つリニューアルモデルの成長に尽力していただきます。主な業務は、顧客の継続率を最大化し、拡大の機会を特定し、高い顧客満足度を実現するための顧客更新の管理です。達成すべき目標をアカウントチームと協力して、顧客契約と関係を維持・改善するための更新プロセスを所有、推進、リードします。主要な意思決定者と積極的に連携し、顧客要件を特定し、障害を解消して、期日通りのコミットメントを確保します。顧客の目標に合致した更新契約を交渉し、実行します。リスクのある顧客と関わり、潜在的な離反を軽減するための具体的な対策を策定します。リスクを明確に伝え、解決策の策定をリードし、必要に応じてエスカレーションします。契約更新時にアップセルの機会を特定し、顧客成長を最大化します。正確な180日間の更新予測を維持し、マネージャーに報告します。システムとプロセスの改善を支援し、効率性を向上させます。顧客管理システム（CRM）を維持し、すべての関連データが適切に記録されるようにします。

またUiPathは単なる仕事場ではありません。個人と職業の成長を促進します。ここでは、スキルを磨く環境、メンターシップを促進する文化、インクルーシブなリーダーシップを推進する組織に浸ることができます。経験豊富な更新チームと実績のあるリーダーたちと協力し、あらゆる場面でサポートを受けることができます。

必要なスキル：

  • ソフトウェア/サブスクリプションの更新またはアカウント管理の経験2～5年 - SaaSの経験は尚可。

  • バリューセールス、ディスカバリー、クロージングスキル、目標達成の実績。

  • 優れた組織力と時間管理能力。

  • 書面および口頭での優れたコミュニケーション能力。

  • 成長マインドセット。

  • 営業とカスタマーサクセスチームと協力して共通の目標を達成する能力。

  • 中堅規模の組織において、ステークホルダーに影響を与え、協力を促進することで、勢いを維持し、契約更新を期日通りに推進する能力。

  • ビジネスと顧客満足度・維持のバランスをとりながら、ペースの速い環境で活き活きと働ける方。

  • 英語は読み書きできるレベルは必須。

※上記の経験が浅くてもやる気と信念をもった活力のある方であれば参加を歓迎します。

仕事内容：

  • アカウントおよびチャネル・マネージャー・チームと連携し、タイムリーな更新を確保し、解約を最小限に抑える。

  • 更新の決定に影響を与える可能性のある異議や問題に積極的に対処する。

  • リニューアルの話し合いを補完する追加サービスや機能を強調する

  • 顧客の利用状況や目標を分析し、アップセルやクロスセルの機会を特定、追求する。

  • アカウントマネージャーおよびチャネルチームと協働し、既存アカウントに新たな収益源を発見する。

  • 顧客に合わせた販売キャンペーンを展開し、製品の普及と価値の拡大を図る。

  • 既存顧客からの収益貢献を予測し、予測可能なパイプラインを維持する。

  • 販売サイクルをよりシンプルにするため、更新とインストールベースのアップ＆クロスセルを行う - 地域ごとに階層モデルを定義する

  • テリトリーのARRとリテンション率の目標達成を確実にするため、アカウントマネージャーや他部門との強力な協力体制を構築する。

  • 複雑な契約更新において、契約構成要素や更新時期などの調整を支援する。

  • 他部門と緊密に連携し、組織全体の整合性と効果的なコミュニケーションを確保する。複数の機能（DH、CS、SE、財務、法務）間の連絡役。

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Federal Strategic Engagement Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your Mission

The Federal Industry Executive will partner with Federal customers as their trusted advisor and subject matter expert at executive levels, and simultaneously partner with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to ensure proper alignment and execution of the strategy. Through extensive dialogue and deep dive analysis, the strategic engagement executive shapes and implements the solution strategy that is unique to the client.

This is what you'll do at UiPath

  • Assess the territory/market potential and develop sales strategy to maximize the revenue potential for UiPath

  • Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within quarterly schedule

  • Evangelize the UiPath business automation platform in the marketplace by presenting, promoting and selling UiPath solutions with a value selling approach

  • Educate customers on how the UiPath business automation platform can benefit them financially and professionally

  • Ensure our largest, most complicated transactions are completed successfully

  • Drive Federal sales motions across multiple sellers from planning, developing businesses cases, structuring deals, and ultimately closing

  • Own c-suite relationships with customers

  • Develop trusted relationships with local partners and global systems integrators to cultivate new opportunities and drive successful customer implementations

  • Partner with Customer Success Manager group to ensure customer receives maximum value and expedites customer issues as they arise

  • Monitor the company’s industry competitors, new products, and market conditions to understand a customer's specific needs

  • Collaborate internally with other sales executives and cross functional groups to foster an environment of knowledge sharing and best practices

  • Explore ways of incorporating automation into daily work

This is what you'll bring to the team

  • 8+ years solution selling experience and recent Strategic Accounts/Global Accounts experience.

  • Must have 5+ years of Enterprise Software sales experience selling into the Federal space.

  • Successful quota attainment YoY and successful experience growing a client portfolio.

  • High aptitude for cross-functional collaboration and cross-functional influence.

  • A strategic thinker and a meticulous, detail-orientated executor.

  • Strong ability to navigate a client organization and develop key points of contact in multiple departments and multiple levels of leadership.

  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with proven track record of quickly building credibility both internally and externally.

  • Research and data driven approach to account planning

  • Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States for this role.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager, Agents&Data
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

At UiPath, we’re redefining how work gets done with automation and AI. We’re now looking for a Product Marketing Manager — Agents & Data who is passionate about building AI-powered workflows that transform how product marketing operates.
This role goes beyond analysis — you’ll be designing, prototyping, and deploying agentic AI workflows that directly support go-to-market strategies, customer insights, and sales enablement. If you’re excited about creating practical AI solutions for real business challenges, this is the place for you.

What you’ll do

  • Build AI Agents: Scope, design, and deploy agent workflows aligned with cross-team product marketing strategies and GTM priorities.

  • Develop data dashboards: Create and manage data plans and dashboards to optimize campaigns, improve content development practices, and refine customer segmentation and targeting.

  • Drive innovation: Experiment with how AI agents can best support product marketers — designing new use cases, automations, and tools.

  • Enable customer analysis: Build and improve workflows and tools for AI-driven analysis of customer feedback and market data.

  • Bridge to sales: Provide sales teams with data-driven insights and AI workflows that strengthen product launches and GTM plans.

What you’ll bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, marketing, data science or equivalent experience.

  • 4+ years’ experience in data, AI or analytics within an AI / SaaS environment.

  • Strong command of English (native-level or near-native).

  • Proven ability to leverage AI and data to analyze complex ideas across the customer journey.

  • Experience working with cross-disciplinary teams and influencing stakeholders at all levels.

  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills, able to communicate with technical and economic buyers alike.

  • Growth mindset, adaptability, and a continuous-improvement attitude.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in automation or RPA.

  • Hands-on experience with UiPath agentic features and Power BI or similar analytics platforms.

  • Strong analytical background and attention to detail; comfortable solving ambiguous problems independently.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Distinguished Engineer- AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

As a Distinguished AI Engineer, you will lead initiatives at the intersection of cutting-edge research and product innovation, pushing the boundaries of machine learning applications in real-world scenarios. You will be a key figure in advancing our machine learning models, optimizing them for performance and scalability, and driving their deployment into production environments. We seek someone who is not only passionate about machine learning theory but also skilled in translating that theory into scalable, efficient, and reliable solutions that address complex problems at scale.

You will be responsible for driving the vision of machine learning advancements, shaping the technical roadmap, and mentoring a talented team of scientists and engineers. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of conducting and applying research with substantial practical impact and is adept at guiding teams to execute on large-scale machine learning projects.

#LI-MH1

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and innovate in the development and deployment of state-of-the-art machine learning models to solve complex and large-scale problems.

  • Design, execute, and oversee large-scale experiments, demonstrating strong experimental intuition and deep technical expertise.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including research scientists and engineers, to scale model training and ensure smooth integration of new models into production environments.

  • Stay ahead of the latest research in machine learning and AI, and strategically incorporate cutting-edge advancements into product solutions.

  • Ensure that machine learning solutions are accessible and user-friendly, contributing to the design of human-computer interfaces for model interaction.

  • Conduct performance benchmarks, statistical analyses, and evaluate the impact of research-based optimizations on real-world problems.

  • Mentor and guide other applied scientists, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.

  • Communicate complex technical concepts and findings effectively across the organization, influencing both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Qualifications:

  • Ph.D. or Master’s degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, or a related field.

  • Extensive experience (10+ years) in applied machine learning, with a proven ability to translate academic research into real-world applications.

  • Expertise in developing models using modern ML libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX.

  • Proficient in multiple programming languages, with a preference for Python and at least one other language (e.g., Rust, C++).

  • Deep understanding of machine learning architectures (including Transformers and other modern models) and experience scaling them to production-level systems.

  • Strong foundation in linear algebra, probability, statistics, and algorithms.

  • Knowledge of GNU/Linux systems, with experience in optimizing large-scale distributed systems for machine learning workloads.

  • Strong publication record in top-tier conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR) is a plus.

  • Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to inspire and mentor a team of researchers and engineers.

  • Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across diverse teams and influence decision-making at the highest levels.

  • Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States for this role.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with large multi-modal models and their practical applications.

  • In-depth knowledge of scalable infrastructure for machine learning, including GPU clusters and cloud-based ML solutions.

  • Experience designing interfaces that make machine learning more accessible and intuitive for end-users.

 

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Enterprise Sales Executive - Czech Market
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

The Enterprise Sales Executive at UiPath will work with top Enterprise accounts across multiple industries in Czechia.

This is a senior position operating with C-Suite decision makers for our top accounts.  

Our sales team is built with experienced, entrepreneurial, and high-energy software sales executives. They work every day with C-level executives and business leaders, through to heads of process improvement and of course automation, to deliver business and individual value to client organizations. 


What you'll do at UiPath

  • Embody our company values: Be Bold, Humble, Immersed, and Fast.

  • Achieve set sales targets and outcomes within quarterly schedule

  • Build UiPath’s brand in the marketplace by presenting, promoting and selling UiPath solutions by leveraging a value selling approach

  • Educate customers on how UiPath solutions can benefit them financially and professionally

  • Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships in the territory

  • Develop trusted relationships with local partners and global systems integrators to cultivate new opportunities and drive successful customer implementations

  • Collaborate with Pre-Sales and Customer Success groups to ensure customer receives maximum value throughout lifecycle

  • Monitor the company’s industry competitors, new products, and market conditions to understand a customer's specific needs


What you'll bring to the team

  • Years of experience selling business solutions directly to top executives for large companies in Czechia

  • Successful quota attainment year-over-year, growing an enterprise client portfolio through new business acquisition and account expansion.

  • High aptitude for cross-functional collaboration and influence, both internally and externally.

  • Ability to work with a client organization and identify important people across many departments and different levels of leadership.

  • Data-oriented approach to territory and account planning, as well as personal performance.

  • Use of MEDDPICC or similar sales methodologies to ensure accuracy in forecasting.

  • Fluency in English and Czech

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. jobs.title: Principal Product Manager, Agentic Automation – Developer Experience
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

This role leads the product direction of UiPath’s pro-developer experience for agentic automation, driving the SDKs, APIs, and agent-framework integrations that empower Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, .NET, and other developers to build automations and AI agents on the UiPath platform. You will pair strategic roadmap leadership with hands-on evangelism—writing sample code, recording demos, and engaging the community. Your north star will be adoption: measurable growth in usage of our SDKs, agentic-automation capabilities, and developer-focused services. The position demands vision, technical fluency, and a passion for creating delightful developer journeys that accelerate enterprise automation.

#LI-MH1

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Define and execute the multi-year roadmap for UiPath’s pro-developer experiences, covering SDKs, CLIs, templates, documentation, and sample applications.

  • Drive integration and first-class support for leading agent frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, CrewAI), making it seamless for developers to bring their own agents to UiPath.

  • Create and maintain canonical demos, tutorials, webinars, blog posts, and conference talks that showcase best practices and accelerate time-to-value for developers.

  • Collaborate with engineering to ensure SDKs are idiomatic, well-tested, versioned, and instrumented with telemetry that captures activation, retention, and feature usage.

  • Establish and track success metrics (e.g., SDK downloads, MAU, time-to-first-success, NPS) to guide continuous improvements and increase uptake of UiPath agentic automation offerings.

  • Gather feedback directly from the developer community (GitHub, forums, events) and translate insights into prioritized product requirements.

  • Partner with marketing, sales engineering, and customer success to launch developer-focused features and enable internal teams to advocate effectively.

  • Mentor cross-functional teams on developer-experience best practices and champion a culture of code samples, open-source collaboration, and data-driven decision making.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 10+ years of experience in product management, developer platforms, or a blended product/devrel role, with a focus on shipping SDKs, APIs, or cloud services for professional developers.

  • Proven ability to write and review production-quality code in Python and JavaScript/TypeScript (additional .NET or Go a plus) to create samples, prototypes, and technical content.

  • Hands-on familiarity with agent development frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, CrewAI, Semantic Kernel, or similar.

  • Track record of evangelizing technology through conference talks, videos, webinars, blog posts, or community leadership that drove measurable adoption.

  • Strong understanding of developer-experience principles: package management, semantic versioning, IDE/tooling integration, CI/CD, and telemetry.

  • Demonstrated success using data-driven approaches to optimize activation, retention, and satisfaction for developer products.

  • Exceptional leadership and communication skills, able to influence engineering, design, and business stakeholders while staying deeply connected to the developer community.

  • Passion for AI-driven automation and a clear vision for how outstanding developer experiences can scale enterprise agentic workflows on the UiPath platform.

  • Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States for this role.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Sales Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As the world moves into an agentic future—the UiPath Platform™ enables AI agents, robots, people, and models to work together harmoniously to revolutionize industries and enhance human potential. As we move towards this exciting future we would like you to join this exciting organization.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Sales Engineer to join our team in the UKI region. In this role, you will blend both technical expertise and business acumen to support the sales process from start to finish. Your primary responsibility will be to identify and understand customer pain points, translating them into tailored, value-driven solutions. Your ability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions will be crucial in delivering exceptional results for our customers.

What you'll do at UiPath

For the client:

  • Participate in account strategy planning with the Sales team

  • Work closely with the Sales team to qualify opportunities and prioritize accordingly

  • Lead end-to-end Presales activities & create strong value propositions

  • Perform tailored, high-level demos demonstrating business value

  • Ensure delivery of strong Rfx’s, contextualized demos and powerful PoV’s

  • Design solutions to fit client needs and environment during the sales process

  • Resolve client concerns around technical capabilities, information security, and platform architecture during the sales process

  • Be an evangelist of UiPath solutions by identifying customer needs and showcasing the best solution

  • Develop solution architectures for customers for secure on-prem, hybrid, and public cloud implementations of the UiPath platform

For UiPath:

  • Participate in knowledge sharing inside and outside of the Presales team

  • Build solutions for different industry verticals

  • Support Marketing initiatives through evangelism activities, including writing blogs, speaking at UiPath events and other industry events

  • Work closely with Product teams for improvement of functionalities and adding external technologies to the UiPath ecosystem

  • Engage in product release cycles to promote new releases and provide feedback on the product roadmap


What you'll bring to the team

  • The ability to work in harmony with our values; Humble, Bold, Immersed, and Fast

  • Good balance of technical, business and sales skills.

  • Demonstrable track record in a client-facing Presales/Sales Engineering/Solution Architect position.

  • Strong communication, discovery and interpersonal skills with proven experience, building strong internal and external relationships.

  • Experience in process discovery, process mining, process orchestration, automation solutions and AI technologies like LLMs and agents.

  • UiPath platform knowledge is a plus.

  • SAP knowledge is a plus.

  • Solid understanding of Cloud and Virtualization technology.

  • Driven approach with a solution selling mindset.

  • Self-motivated, proactive approach with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty and adoption.

  • Team player attitude with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

  • Willing to travel.

#LI-MB1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Solution Architect - Partner Enablement JP
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

UiPathの社員は、エージェンティック・オートメーションが世界を変える変革をもたらすと信じています。私たちはその力を解き放つ、業界をリードするエンタープライズソフトウェアの開発に尽力しています。またUiPathの日本法人は、日本のお客様に最大限貢献することを目指し、独立性のある一つの組織として一丸となり取り組んでいます。RPAのロボットとAIエージェントとヒトが協働する未来の働き方を、一緒に実現しませんか？

そのために、好奇心旺盛で、自ら進んで動けるフットワークの軽い人材を求めています。ビジネスのスピードや変化を喜びとし、互いを思いやり、成長意欲のある仲間が必要です。UiPathでエージェンティックオートメーションを実現し、共に社会を変革しましょう。

Summary: As a Solution Architect, you will be a vital member of the UiPath Technical Partner Enablement team. You will guide partners in designing scalable, enterprise-wide automation solutions, promote strong design practices, align solutions with enterprise roadmaps, and apply AI and architecture best practices to deliver robust, agentic systems.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Develop and maintain strong relationships with key partners, providing guidance and training to build their technical expertise and ensure long term success with UiPath solutions.

2. Conduct interactive workshops with clients to showcase UiPath products, driving engagement and increasing knowledge of automation capabilities.

3. Lead partners in the design, implementation, and maintenance of enterprise-wide automation solutions, ensuring scalability and alignment with business objectives.

4. Provide pre-sales support as a technical subject matter expert, guiding clients through technical requirements, and facilitating the sales process.

5. Take responsibility for ongoing recommendations and best practices for automation implementations, custom solutions, product support, and enhancing the UiPath Enterprise Platform.

6. Prepare technical presentations, white papers and case studies to support both internal and external stakeholders.

7. Identify customer requirements, analyze alternatives, and conduct solution recommendations related to software, platform, and network configurations.

8. Support partners in the implementation of advanced automation strategies, leveraging AI, RPA and cloud technologies to maximize operational efficiency and innovation.

9. Foster a culture of continuous learning, encouraging partners to stay up-to-date with UiPath certifications, product updates, and industry advancements to maintain technical expertise.

Qualifications:

1. 7+ years of experience in the IT industry

2. 3+ years of hands-on experience with UiPath, either as a Solution Architect or Developer, demonstrating deep knowledge of RPA best practices and the UiPath platform

3. Advanced UiPath Developer Certification or equivalent experience

4. Understanding of Enterprise Architecture, IT systems and Security best practices

5. Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to build good relationships with multiple stakeholders at all levels. Fluency in both Japanese and English is required to collaborate with diverse teams and clients.

6. Experience with other leading automation platforms (e.g., Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, Power Automate) is a plus.

7. Familiarity with Langchain and other agentic frameworks is highly desirable.

8. Experience with UiPath Infrastructure related technologies is an advantage (includes major cloud platforms, Windows and Linux administration, Kubernetes, etc)

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Driver
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As a Software Engineer on the Driver team, you’ll be at the heart of how users interact with automation. The Driver team builds the automation drivers that power UiPath's interaction layer across a wide range of platforms – from modern browsers and native desktop apps to legacy systems.
Your role will be to design and develop automation capabilities that make our platform more adaptable, performant, and intuitive. Whether you're deep-diving into OS internals or optimizing DOM-level interactions, your work will help UiPath deliver on its promise of the Fully Automated Enterprise™ — where automation removes barriers to scale and unleashes human potential.

What You’ll Do at UiPath

  • Design and implement core automation capabilities for the Driver layer.

  • Develop support for interacting with both web and desktop applications across various UI frameworks (e.g., Win32, WPF, web-based UIs).

  • Ensure the delivery of performant, secure, and maintainable code that meets scalability and extensibility requirements.

  • Adapt automation capabilities to accommodate new operating system updates, UI technologies, and diverse customer environments.

  • Debug and optimize low-level components that interface directly with system and browser APIs.

  • Maintain a high bar for code quality, testability, and cross-platform consistency in the automation layer.


What You’ll Bring to the Team

  • Strong programming skills in one or more of the following: C++, C, JavaScript, TypeScript or C#— and a curiosity to learn others.

  • Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and software design patterns.

  • Experience with asynchronous programming, multithreading, and synchronization mechanisms.

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and time/memory complexity analysis.

  • Comfortable working close to the OS — understanding how applications interact with system-level APIs.

  • Familiarity with browser internals, DOM APIs, and desktop UI frameworks like WPF, Windows Forms, or Electron would represent a plus.

  • Experience with low-level Windows technologies (e.g., Windows API, COM, ATL), reverse engineering, and debugging tools such as WinDbg or Procmon would represent a plus,


Why Join the Driver Team at UiPath?
We're the team that makes automation possible at the interaction layer. Every OS update, UI framework, or customer scenario presents a new challenge — and an opportunity to innovate. You'll never get bored here: there’s always something new to explore, reverse-engineer, or optimize. You’ll work in a highly technical, low-ego environment where engineering depth is valued, and your work has direct, global impact. If you enjoy solving hard problems and building scalable, elegant solutions that power real-world automation, the Driver team is where you belong.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, AI Trust Layer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

Our mission as a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team is to ensure the stability, scalability, and efficiency of our organization's digital infrastructure. We strive to deliver exceptional reliability, performance, and availability for our customers and internal stakeholders. Through the application of automation, best practices, and a relentless focus on continuous improvement, we aim to create a robust and resilient platform that powers our services without interruption.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Operational Efficiency: Lead designing systems/solutions at org scale, streamlining processes and enhancing efficiency.

  • AIOps: Use AI tools and agents to improve SLO/SLAs and reduce toil.

  • Capacity & LLM Operations: Manage provisioning, capacity, and availability of large language models across multiple cloud providers and global regions. Build telemetry, dashboards, and automated triggers to optimize utilization, adjust allocations, and ensure efficient cost management in collaboration with partner services.

  • Monitoring/Observability Architecture: Develop and implement monitoring agents, dashboards, escalations, and alerts to proactively manage and improve service reliability.

  • Incident Management: Participate in a distributed on-call rotation, drive root cause analysis during outages, and write and review postmortems to continuously improve our services and practices.

  • Team Growth: Advocate for SRE best practices, work independently, and help grow the SRE team by onboarding and mentoring new teammates.

What you'll bring to the team

  • Hands-On Experience: Demonstrate 5-10 years of practical experience in DevOps or site reliability within commercial large-scale software Organizations with a focus on Network and HTTP performance optimization.

  • Experience in AI agents and/or AIOps.

  • Proficiency in coding languages (such as Python, Go).

  • Live Site Troubleshooting: Adept at troubleshooting live site issues and providing guidance to engineering teams to resolve them promptly.

  • Cloud Proficiency: Possess a good understanding of public cloud offerings such as Azure, Google Cloud, or AWS.

  • Distributed Systems: Experience with distributed systems and micro-service-based architectures.

  • Performance Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of web application performance, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement. Utilize various monitoring tools and performance profiling techniques to diagnose and troubleshoot performance issues.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Technical Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

Your mission

How would you like to help the world’s largest companies transform the way they work via automation, allowing their team members to achieve their full potential? As members of our Enterprise Success team, our Technical Account Managers help our French customers achieve more than they ever have by automating the day-to-day and driving business to a higher level.

Our UiPath Enterprise Success team advises and guides our most strategic customers in designing and building long-term, enterprise level business automation programs leveraging our people and technology, ensuring our customers achieve maximum business value and organizational impact leveraging the world’s most innovative and proven business automation platform.

We entrust our team with UiPath’s largest and most strategic customers, working with stakeholders across all parts of the business and at all levels (C-suite down), to drive business adoption of our capabilities with maniacal focus on achieving tangible business outcomes while enhancing the way their team members work.

Our Enterprise Success team is serious about guiding our customers in designing and managing their UiPath business automation platform across the full platform lifecycle, including coaching our customers’ teams on initial deployment, enterprise-wide enablement, and the appropriate methodologies to maximize business outcomes, self-sufficiency, and overall organizational impact.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Take ownership of your customers' technical success with the UiPath Platform

  • Be a core member of the UiPath account team for each of your customers, accountable for technical workstreams that help your customers strategize and execute adoption plans that will return exceptional business value

  • Proactively engage and influence your customers, providing embedded technical advisory and guiding the technical maturity of your customers' automation programs to help them achieve their objectives and elevate their line of sight as to what can be achieved

  • Provide UiPath Platform infrastructure, installation and upgrade planning, guided assistance, and troubleshooting

  • Enable your customers' technical stakeholders on UiPath Platform best practices relevant to their unique automation pipelines, program objectives, environments, and constraints

  • Conduct design and code reviews for select automations to reinforce and verify those best practices

  • Perform technical health checks of your customers' automation programs and environments, identifying risks and opportunities for continuous improvement across technical disciplines

  • Collaborate with UiPath Product Support and other subject matter experts to manage, facilitate, communicate, and bring to positive closure escalated support incidents

  • Provide technical advisory to customers through webinars, demos, and speaking engagements

  • Develop and mature our teams’ processes, assets, and methodologies in an agile manner to continually iterate and maintain best-in-class delivery

What you'll bring to the team

  • A degree in Computer Science or relevant degree

  • A minimum 5 years experience in programming .NET / Java applications (C#, C++, VB, Java or Powershell), SaaS and Cloud experience a benefit

  • Fluency in written and spoken English and French

  • Relevant work experience with progressive responsibility in customer-facing, technical account management or technical consulting roles

  • Work experience to credibly communicate with and guide customers on diverse technical topics, including software engineering, packaging and deployment, cloud technologies, and infrastructure engineering

  • Previous experience working with UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, Pega or Nice is preferred

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, self-motivated, proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty and adoption

  • Diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working through customer issues.

  • Willingness to travel for client interactions up to 25% of the time

#LI-CD3

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Mid Market/Enterprise Territory Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

The Mid Market/Enterprise Territory Manager at UiPath will be full responsible for developing a regionally organized set of customers. This includes new as well as existing
Mid Market and Enterprise clients.

Operating on all levels is required, including C-Suite decision makers.
The team is built with committed, entrepreneurial and high-energy software
sales executives. They work every day with innovators and business leaders,
through to heads of process improvement and of course automation, to deliver
business and individual value at client organisations.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Operate in harmony with our company values: Bold, Humble, Immersed,
    and Fast

  • Achieve set sales targets and outcomes within quarterly schedule

  • Build UiPath’s brand in the marketplace by presenting, promoting and
    selling UiPath solutions. Become the UiPath “face to the market” for the
    respective territory.

  • Develop trusted relationships with local partners and global systems
    integrators to cultivate new opportunities and drive successful customer
    implementations

  • Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer
    relationships in the territory

  • Collaborate with Pre-Sales and other supporting functions to ensure best-
    in-class customer experience

  • Monitor the company’s industry competitors, new products, and market
    conditions to understand a customer's specific needs

What you'll bring to the team

  • High level of energy, enthusiasm and entrepreneurship. Multiple years of
    experience in sales.

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills in German and
    English

  • High aptitude for cross-functional collaboration and cross functional
    influence internally and externally

  • Ability to work self-sufficiently with limited direction in a fast-paced
    environment; must be a high energy, motivated self-starter.

  • Data-orientated approach to territory planning, as well as personal
    performance

  • This role is based in our Munich office

#LI-GW1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: SAP Functional Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As a SAP Functional Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the implementation, maintenance, and optimization of SAP systems to meet business needs. This role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business processes, gather requirements, and design effective SAP solutions.
The SAP Functional Analyst also serves as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring the successful delivery of SAP projects and enhancements.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Collaborate with business users to understand their needs and translate them into SAP requirements SAP S/4HANA

  • Conduct detailed analysis of business requirements and translate them into functional specifications and Implement business approved configuration to meet business requirements

  • Perform gap analysis to determine the necessary customization for S/4HANA implementation or enhancement

  • Support integration of S/4HANA with other systems and ensure smooth data flows between modules and external applications

  • Develop test scenarios, conduct unit and integration testing, and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) with business users

  • Validate that SAP S/4HANA configurations meet business requirements and resolve any issues before deployment

  • Ensure data integrity and accurate reporting within the S/4HANA environment

  • Document system processes, configurations, and workflows for reference and future enhancements

  • Provide ongoing support and guidance to ensure business users are proficient in using SAP S/4HANA

What you'll bring to the team

  • Proven experience as an SAP Business Analyst with a focus on S/4HANA implementations and configurations

  • Strong understanding of core SAP S/4HANA modules (e.g., SAP FI, SAP AA (Asset Accounting), Intercompany, Lease) etc.

  • Experience with SAP S/4HANA configuration and system integration

  • Experience in business process modeling and optimization using S/4HANA

  • Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues within the S/4HANA environment

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements

  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and project management skills

  • SAP S/4HANA certification is a plus

  • Ability to work in a multicultural and distributed context (e.g., IT project teams and business stakeholders in disperse locations around the world

  • Ability to work in a hybrid model (onsite, remote, international travel)

  • Quick learner and easy adaptable to new technologies

  • Problem solver and the ability to define and communicate the “big picture” in terms of the overall integration solution and break it down into smaller manageable work units.

    Proven experience:

  • Proven participation in large size projects with a delivery coordination role is a plus

  • Minimum 5 years' experience in S/4 HANA Finance

  • Core Finance background with Certification in S/4 HANA Finance or any automation/Innovation tool is a plus.

    #LI-CS1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Solution Architect
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

As a Solution Architect you work with businesses and Partners to help them leverage full potential of UiPath Automation Platform. You would involve in Designing, Developing, Testing and Building world class robots that impacts revenue growth, operational efficiencies, customer/Employee satisfaction of our end customers. You will be part of a group of elite Developers in UiPath Professional Service and may lead a few

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Design, code and test automation workflows using UiPath.

  • Develop a stable/reusable and scalable RPA solution design using UiPath.

  • Decide on the development methodologies and best practices.

  • Verifying and leveraging appropriate UiPath components from UiPath Product Suite.

  • Provide solution designs to customers throughout the deployment of new deals, during POCs (Proof of Concept) and project implementation phase.

  • Oversee the development of the automation projects and components according to the solution design and requirements.

  • Oversee the testing, deployment, hyper care, and monitoring stages.

  • Review the crucial pieces of code and facilitate knowledge transfer in the project team.

  • Develop workflows and custom activities using VB.NET/C#.

  • Responsible for the overall testing cycles

  • Deliver technical training, demos, and blueprints and provide necessary support for new/existing clients.

  • Mentor budding Developers and Architects.

What you'll bring to the team

  • Graduate/Postgraduate in Computer Science/IT or equivalent Degree.

  • 10+ years of experience in the IT industry with code development background.

  • Minimum of 4 years of experience in developing and implementing automation workflows in UiPath.

  • Experience leading a Team of at least 4 members.

  • Strong technical skills on UiPath, and end to end UiPath Product Suite.

  • Understanding of workflow-based logic and hands on experience with RE-framework,

  • Orchestration Framework and DU (Document Understanding) Framework.

  • Working Knowledge on Document Understanding, Computer Vision, AI Center and Action Center

  • Experience working with Mainframe Automation, SAP Automation or Citrix Automation is a plus.

  • Experience working with other RPA tools is a plus.

  • UiPath Automation Solution Architect Professional certified are preferred.

  • Excellent communication skills are a must.

  • Basic programming/Scripting knowledge on VBA/VB/java/C# script or equivalent is must (or any scripting language, python is a plus)

  • Knowledge in cognitive automation with OCR (Optical Character Recognition) tools, AI/ML skills is a plus.

  • Understanding UiPath Infrastructure requirements is a plus.

  • Experience Working with Test Suite, Apps, Insights is a plus.

  • Understanding Generative AI and new releases of UiPath is a plus.

  • Understanding of Cloud services like Azure/AWS/GCP is a plus

#LI-MR1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

 - Orchestration Framework and DU (Document Understanding) Framework.

 - Working Knowledge on Document Understanding, Computer Vision, AI Center and Action Center

 - Experience working with Mainframe Automation, SAP Automation or Citrix Automation is a plus.

 - Experience working with other RPA tools is a plus.

 - UiPath Automation Solution Architect Professional certified are preferred.

 - Excellent communication skills are a must.

 - Basic programming/Scripting knowledge on VBA/VB/java/C# script or equivalent is must (or any scripting language, python is a plus)

 - Knowledge in cognitive automation with OCR (Optical Character Recognition) tools, AI/ML skills is a plus.

 - Understanding UiPath Infrastructure requirements is a plus.

 - Experience Working with Test Suite, Apps, Insights is a plus.

 - Understanding Generative AI and new releases of UiPath is a plus.

 - Understanding of Cloud services like Azure/AWS/GCP is a plus

#LI-MR1

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. jobs.title: Technical Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your Mission
At UiPath, you'll empower the world's largest companies to transform their operations through automation, enabling their teams to reach their full potential. As a Technical Account Manager on our Client Success team, you'll guide our most strategic customers in building enterprise-level business automation programs. Your role will be crucial in ensuring our customers achieve maximum business value and organizational impact using UiPath's innovative automation platform. You'll work with stakeholders across all levels, from C-suite executives to team members, driving business adoption with a laser focus on achieving tangible outcomes and enhancing work processes.


What you'll do at UiPath

  • Take ownership of customers' technical success with the UiPath Platform, being accountable for technical workstreams that drive exceptional business value.

  • Proactively engage with customers, providing embedded technical advisory to mature their automation programs and expand their vision of achievable goals.

  • Guide UiPath Platform infrastructure planning, installation, upgrades, and troubleshooting processes.

  • Enable customer technical stakeholders on UiPath Platform best practices, tailored to their unique automation needs and constraints.

  • Conduct design and code reviews for select automations to reinforce and verify best practices.

  • Perform technical health checks of customer automation programs, identifying risks and opportunities for continuous improvement.

  • Collaborate with UiPath Product Support and subject matter experts to resolve escalated support incidents efficiently.

What you'll bring to the team

  • Degree in Computer Science or a relevant field

  • Fluency in Spanish & English

  • 3+ years of experience in programming .NET / Java / Python, with 2+ years of cloud experience (Azure/AWS/GCP)

  • Proven track record in customer-facing technical account management or consulting roles

  • Expertise in diverse technical topics, including software engineering, deployment, cloud technologies, and infrastructure engineering

  • Experience working with agentic frameworks like Langgraph, CrewAi or familiarity with LLMs, Intelligent Document Processing, RAG, MCP and BPMN is an advantage

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive and innovative approach to customer success

  • Previous experience working with UiPath products is preferred. If not, experience with Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, Power Automate, Pega RPA or Nice RPA is a plus.

#LI-SG3

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

jobs.title: Senior Sales Engineer I
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Life at UiPath

The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.

To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.

Could that be you?

Your mission

The Senior Solution Engineer is a senior-level technical expert and trusted advisor to customers, prospects, and UiPath’s field Sales organization. In this role, you will guide complex sales engagements, deeply understand customer challenges, and architect solutions and “art of the possible” scenarios that deliver meaningful business outcomes. With significant customer-facing experience, you will lead technical strategy in the field, build strong executive relationships, and influence key decision-makers throughout the sales cycle.

As a senior technical expert, you will partner closely with Sales, Product, and Customer Success teams to align UiPath’s capabilities with customer priorities. You will also coach and mentor junior team members, helping elevate the overall technical acumen of the team.

What you'll do at UiPath

  • Own the technical strategy for key accounts and lead end-to-end technical engagement in complex enterprise sales cycles.

  • Design and deliver compelling, industry-relevant demonstrations and Proof of Concepts that showcase UiPath’s innovation and strategic value.

  • Lead discovery workshops with customers to uncover pain points and map them to UiPath, AI, or automation-driven solutions.

  • Translate technical solutions into business value, helping shape customer vision and influence executive stakeholders.

  • Stay ahead of automation, AI, and digital transformation trends to advise customers with insight and credibility.

  • Mentor and coach junior Solution Engineers, providing guidance on best practices and solution design.

  • Deliver executive-level presentations that clearly articulate technical concepts in business terms.

  • Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Services teams to channel field insights and influence roadmap decisions.

What you'll bring to the team

  • 8+ years of experience in a technical, customer-facing role, with either:

  • Proven presales experience (owning technical strategy, running POCs/demos, shaping deals), or

  • Consulting/solution architect experience (advising customers, designing solutions, leading digital/AI/automation programs).

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with UiPath, or equivalent automation platforms, or AI/ML technologies, demonstrating deep platform and architectural expertise.

  • Proven track record of successfully leading technical engagements in enterprise sales cycles.

  • Strong business acumen and the ability to connect technical solutions (automation, AI, or digital transformation) to customer outcomes.

  • Experience engaging C-level stakeholders and guiding both technical and business strategy across diverse industries.

  • Proficiency in one or more programming or scripting languages (e.g., Python, C#, Java) and experience solving real-world technical problems.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including comfort presenting to executive and technical audiences.

  • Demonstrated leadership in mentoring peers and contributing to team growth.

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field—or equivalent professional experience.

Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.

Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.
